title: Data-Driven Social-Emotional Learning (SEL) Design Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of elementary education curricula and awareness of SEL (Social-Emotional Learning) concepts
context.additional_context: Project-based learning where graduate students (educational studies majors) apply data-driven approaches to SEL (Social-Emotional Learning) lesson design from an elementary teacherâ€™s perspective.

learning_goals: Learners can establish data collection and analysis plans for designing SEL lessons according to the DILD model.
Learners can develop SEL lesson modules that reflect students' social-communicative, metacognitive, and affective learning characteristics.
Learners can measure the effectiveness of online SEL lessons and propose improvements using data-driven feedback.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
